org_name: Betty Jean Kerr People's Health Centers

request_pathways.name: Mail to Privacy Officer at 5701 Delmar Blvd

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Organization lists fax, mail, in-person, and patient portal as submission channels on a dedicated webpage, but provides no downloadable form; patients must visit in person or log into the portal to obtain the actual request form.

red_flags: No ROI/authorization form available online despite dedicated records request page
Fee disclosure is vague — mentions costs of copying, mailing, labor, and supplies but provides no amounts or reference to HIPAA fee limits
NPP missing effective date (required by 45 CFR 164.520) and breach notification language (required post-HITECH), suggesting document has not been updated in over a decade
Patient Rights and Responsibilities PDF returns 500 Internal Server Error — broken link on parent organization site
bright_spots: Dedicated 'Requests for Release of Health Information' webpage with clear contact information
Named Privacy Officer with direct phone number provided
Multiple submission channels listed (fax, mail, portal, in-person)

findability.rationale: Level 2: The records request page is findable via site navigation, but no actual ROI form exists online despite persistent and creative search strategies — the patient finds instructions but not the form itself.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 1: No usable digital ROI form exists; the only retrieved document is an NPP (not an ROI form), and the actual authorization form is available only in-person or behind a login-required portal.

content_design.rationale: Level 1: No ROI form was available to assess; the NPP document is dense, legalistic, contains numbering errors and encoding artifacts, and lacks a plain-language summary — but it is not itself the relevant form for patient access.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 1: The process effectively requires in-person visit or existing portal credentials to even obtain the request form; no publicly accessible pathway for patient self-access exists, and there is no differentiation between patient access and third-party release.

compliance.rationale: Level 2: While fax and mail channels theoretically exist, the absence of a form to submit through them creates a de facto in-person requirement; the NPP omits required elements (effective date, breach notification) and fee disclosures are vague with no amounts stated.

overall.summary: BJKPHC publishes no downloadable ROI form, effectively requiring patients to visit in person or already have portal credentials to request their own records — a fundamental failure of online accessibility for an FQHC.
